comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: It seems poor Ms. Szabo drowned while rowing with one Burton Gibson. Foul play was involved & Gibson stood trial for her murder. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E0DEEDC133CE633A... An imposter claimed to be her mother: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9505E6D8123CE633A... There's a lot of links about this case at the NY Times archive.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: there are now some photos of the crowd gathered for the arrest of Gibson.  Click on Szabo tag to see them.

comment.author: 37970645@N03
comment._content:
If anyone is interested: Burton Wilkes Gibson was found guilty of a lesser charge I believe. He was sentenced to Auburn State Prison. He's my 2x great-grandfather (from my mom's side) and reconnected with my family after getting out. His grand-daughter (my Grandmom) tells me one night, Burton just vanished. His ID and everything else was found in his home. He was never seen again.

Burton came from a family of farmers. His parents Joseph Gibson and Emily Alletta (White) Gibson sold the farm to help pay for his legal fees.

Burton's wife Maud Isabella (O'Dwyer) Gibson and his daughter Marian lived with Maud's parents in New Jersey.

I'm doing family history research. If anyone has any info please email me at Questor1981@hotmail.com.
